You have reached SAL, the Sensitive Artificial Listeners.
If you want to know about the system from scratch, go ahead and ask.
If you already know, go ahead and say which of us you want to talk to.
These are the listeners you can choose.
Poppy is cheerful, optimistic and she looks on the bright side of life!
Spike is aggressive, confrontational and he enjoys an argument.
Obadiah is gloomy, and he has a pessimistic outlook.
Prudence is matter-of-fact, and takes a practical view on life.
SALAS is a package designed to let a user work through various emotional states.
The package contains four 'personalities' who listen to the user and respond to what he or she says.
Each of the 'personalities' has different emotional characteristics.
The user controls the emotional tone of the interaction by choosing which 'personality' he or she talks to.
He or she can change the tone at any time by choosing a different personality to talk to.
Using SALAS.
The personalities are very crude.
They do not understand content, only tone.
That means it is up to the user to work within the system's limits.
In particular, there is no point asking it questions.
There is no point trying to get into a serious discussion with it.
There is no point going into long monologues.
There is no point trying to outwit it: that is so easy it is not much fun.
The trick is to make use of what the system does offer: a kind of sounding board, which will make the sorts of noises you ask for.
That is a very limited function, but you might be surprised how much you can do with it.
